alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin; Hall; Harlan; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 1:38AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following counties, Adams, Franklin, Hall, Harlan, Kearney and Webster. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that minor flooding of mainly small creeks and possibly some rural roads is likely still ongoing in parts of the Advisory area, due to between 1 up to around 4 inches of rain that fell mainly Friday evening. Additional rainfall early this morning should only average around one-quarter inch before coming to an end. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... South Branch Sand Creek, West Fork Farmers Creek, Thompson Creek, Lovely Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, East Branch Thompson Creek, Thirtytwo Mile Creek, Sand Creek, Pawnee Creek,Turkey Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, West Branch Thompson Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Middle Branch Thompson Creek, Ash Creek, Scott Creek, West Branch Thirtytwo Mile Creek, Center Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Franklin, Kenesaw, Doniphan, Juniata, Campbell, Holstein, Upland, Bloomington, Prosser and Norman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Franklin; Hall; Harlan; Kearney; Webster
